title: Ticket #952: Add configure switch to build with new / old classads
description: Arrange header and make files so that switching between old and new ClassAds can be done with the flip of a switch.
remarks:
2010-Jan-14 16:32:57 by jfrey:
The master branch can now be built with or without old ClassAds. This will apply to Condor 7.5.1 and later. On unix, configure now takes a --enable/disable-old-classads parameter (enable is the default). On Windows, use of old ClassAds is hard-coded for now. Building with old ClassAds works everywhere (including passing the test suite). Building without old ClassAds works on x86 rhel5, but doesn't run yet.
check_ins:
2010-Jan-11 17:20   Check-in [16864]: Fix hash_map usage in new ClassAds on Windows. #990 The hash_map implementation varies slightly between gcc and Windows. (By Jaime Frey )
2009-Dec-25 22:20   Check-in [16790]: Add option to replace old ClassAds with compatibility layer. #619 Configure now accepts a --enable/disable-old-classads option, which sets macro WANT_OLD_CLASSADS. If --disable-old-classads is given, old ClassAds are removed, replaced by compat_classad::ClassAd. The default is to use old ClassAds. (By Jaime Frey )
